        Throws:

      • getIntValue

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.Integer getIntValue(int formatType,
                                                       int offset,
                                                       java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
        Return an Integer value of the specified type. This operation will not advance the internal offset to the next position. The formatType parameter determines how the byte array is to be interpreted. For example, setting formatType to FORMAT_UINT16 specifies that the first two bytes of the byte array at the given offset are interpreted to generate the return value.
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array.
        offset - Offset at which the integer value can be found.
        byteOrder - the byte order, either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        an Integer value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are not enough bytes for an Integer value
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value of byteOrder is null

      • getFloatValue

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.Float getFloatValue(int formatType)
        Return a float value of the specified format. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array
        Returns:
        The float value at the position of the internal offset and set ByteOrder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are not enough bytes for an Float value

public @NotNull java.lang.Float getFloatValue(int formatType,
                                                       @NotNull
                                                       @NotNull java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
        Return a float value of the specified format and byte order. This operation will automatically advance the internal offset to the next position.
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array
        byteOrder - the byte order, either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        The float value at the position of the internal offset
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are not enough bytes for an Float value
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value of byteOrder is null

      • getFloatValue

        @NotNull
public @NotNull java.lang.Float getFloatValue(int formatType,
                                                       int offset,
                                                       @NotNull
                                                       @NotNull java.nio.ByteOrder byteOrder)
        Return a Float value of the specified format, offset and byte order. This operation will not advance the internal offset to the next position.
        Parameters:
        formatType - The format type used to interpret the byte array (FORMAT_SFLOAT or FORMAT_FLOAT)
        byteOrder - the byte order, either LITTLE_ENDIAN or BIG_ENDIAN
        Returns:
        The float value at the position of the internal offset
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are not enough bytes for an Float value or if the formatType is not FORMAT_SFLOAT or FORMAT_FLOAT
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the value of byteOrder is null
